title: GATES ORB / communistquest
description: Rhetoric smells a communist around here. Part of the Communist Dream Quest

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "There it is again! There's a spectr..."
dialogueTree.text: There it is again! There's a spectral smell haunting this industrial harbour. And it smells like...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Heavy fuel oil, mostly. Because it'..."
links.text: Heavy fuel oil, mostly. Because it's an industrial harbour.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Years of turmoil, of hopes and drea..."
links.text: Years of turmoil, of hopes and dreams ground beneath the inexorable tides of capital.

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.text: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)

links.title: You: "I *still* don't smell anything."
links.text: I *still* don't smell anything.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Nonsense. The reek of communism is..."
links.text: Nonsense. The reek of communism is unmistakable, and it's coming... from that railing over there!

links.title: You: "I can *kind of* smell dreams being..."
links.text: I can *kind of* smell dreams being ground down by capital.

links.title: You: "Smell what?"
links.text: Smell what?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Can you not detect that inimitable..."
links.text: Can you not detect that inimitable *whiff* of dissatisfaction and restlessness, that sense that the world is in need of dramatic, even *violent* re-ordering?

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.text: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)

links.title: Rhetoric: "Can you smell it now?"
links.text: Can you smell it now?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "You inhale. The cilia along your ol..."
links.text: You inhale. The cilia along your olfactory epithelium tingle with excitement as they sift through the swirling morass of industrial odours...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "First come the smells of the agitat..."
links.text: First come the smells of the agitated strikebreakers, layers of body oil and sweat, over-buttered meals pulled from bakelite lunch pails, the biting stench of lye soap. And then there's the slowly oxidizing metal gates, the scent of stale grease emanating from every crack...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Still smelling for communists, det..."
links.text: "Still smelling for communists, detective?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I'll be over here when you'v..."
links.text: "Well, I'll be over here when you've finished." The lieutenant nudges something on the ground with his foot.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "His impatience is feigned. He's cur..."
links.text: His impatience is feigned. He's curious to see how this *personal errand* shakes out.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He'll tolerate this *personal erran..."
links.text: He'll tolerate this *personal errand*, but his patience is wearing thin.

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Uh huh.""
links.text: "Uh huh."

links.title: Drama: "The lieutenant issss not persuaded,..."
links.text: The lieutenant issss not persuaded, sssssire.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What the lieutenant thinks is irrel..."
links.text: What the lieutenant thinks is irrelevant. Your politico-olfactory cortex is lighting up like a holiday display. Look, it's pointing you right... to that railing over there!

links.title: You: ""What makes you say that?""
links.text: "What makes you say that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No offence, detective, but you're..."
links.text: "No offence, detective, but you're not particularly *subtle*."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The lieutenant's right. It's sort o..."
links.text: The lieutenant's right. It's sort of amazing how un-subtly you're sniffing the air around you, almost like you're *trying* to call attention to yourself.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective?" T..."
links.text: "Everything in order, detective?" The lieutenant gives you a quizzical look.

links.title: You: ""It's kind of a personal errand.""
links.text: "It's kind of a personal errand."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A *personal errand*.""
links.text: "A *personal errand*."

links.title: You: ""I'm smelling for communists, Kim.""
links.text: "I'm smelling for communists, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're smelling for...""
links.text: "You're smelling for..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know what? I'll just leave you..."
links.text: "You know what? I'll just leave you to it. Carry on, detective."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It is a mark of the lieutenant's re..."
links.text: It is a mark of the lieutenant's respect for you that he does not press you on this decidedly *extra-curricular* errand.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm struggling to see the connecti..."
links.text: "I'm struggling to see the connection with our investigation, but I'm sure *all will be revealed* in time."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Nota bene: The lieutenant is not at..."
links.text: Nota bene: The lieutenant is not at all convinced that anything will be revealed.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In the interest of our investigati..."
links.text: "In the interest of our investigation, I suggest you focus on the case at hand. You can pursue your *political projects* after hours."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant is not pleased with..."
links.text: The lieutenant is not pleased with this turn of events, but it's unlikely that he'll move to intervene to stop them.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The lieutenant lacks your *highly d..."
links.text: The lieutenant lacks your *highly developed* politico-olfactory cortex. The reek of communism is undeniable. And it's coming... from that railing right there!

links.title: You: ""I'm working on developing my polit..."
links.text: "I'm working on developing my political consciousness."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're developing your...""
links.text: "You're developing your..."

links.title: You: ""Just taking in the fresh air, like..."
links.text: "Just taking in the fresh air, like a normal detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a lot to take in, isn't th..."
links.text: "There's a lot to take in, isn't there?" The lieutenant wrinkles his nose.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "In a word, exactly what you would e..."
links.text: In a word, exactly what you would expect to find at any harbour in the industrialized world...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "No, actually. In fact, you can't sm..."
links.text: No, actually. In fact, you can't smell much of *anything*. Perhaps your allergies are acting up?

links.title: You: "Does that mean there's a communist..."
links.text: Does that mean there's a communist nearby?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Undoubtedly. And the scent is comin..."
links.text: Undoubtedly. And the scent is coming... from that railing over there!

links.title: You: "You mean from Mañana?"
links.text: You mean from Mañana?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Yes. Now's your chance to *establis..."
links.text: Yes. Now's your chance to *establish contact*.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "But be easy about it. Communists ha..."
links.text: But be easy about it. Communists have been known to charge when startled.

links.title: You: "You mean from the skinny guy in the..."
links.text: You mean from the skinny guy in the red hat?

links.title: You: "I don't smell anything."
links.text: I don't smell anything.
